text:
Hey, has this issue been resolved for you?
We had a similar thing happen to us yesterday (22.05.) on an app that's been working with the same workflow action for over a year without any issues. Suddenly it started reporting that `CONDITIONAL_SINGLE_FIELD` is not a valid field type. Unfortunately, I forgot to save a screenshot. The endpoint worked on its own (the same as in your case).
Yesterday I couldn't find anything wrong with the app or the action and this morning when I wanted to resume debugging, everything was working normally.
why?
you can write  normal HTML inside the template and have it written directly into the template. Then only the dnd_sections can be edited
However, that is not a good idea, as changes to the  template would only apply for new, but not existing pages.

Hello everybody,
I have a question: I want to insert a logo in an email marketing, how to do it? Knowing that the logo I have already undergreed from the company's domain name
Thank you

Hello guys, I am interested to know more about perfromance issues of a HubSpot hosted website. I am having problems with minimize main thread work 6.5seconds (scirpt evaluation 3.6s)  , javascript exectuion time (Unattributable	1,732S m PLUS 1023MS	 _lighthouse-eval.js)  and reduce unused javascript ?

Hello Guys

We are currently in the process of integrating our CTI widget from HubSpot. While the outgoing functionality is functioning well, we are facing challenges with the implementation of incoming or inbound calling.
One specific issue we are encountering is the inability to display an incoming call popup. We would greatly appreciate your assistance in guiding us on how to successfully implement this feature.
<@U01QVR44MEY> can you please help us

Currently this is a limitation (and it should be stated in the github and docs) but the only way to receive inbound calls in HubSpot is through HubSpot calling at this point. Looks like it will be a feature that is added to the SDK in the nearish future but the inbound calling through normal HubSpot calling is still in beta so it's probably still a bit away

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report.a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hello,


Is it even possible to filter on standard tags within HubSpot?

So I added text standard tags to my blog_post template
```{% text "project_region" label="Enter region here", value="" %}```
So in my blog I can now add text there and add a region to the blog.

On my blog lising page i can get this by doing

```        {% for content in contents %}
          {{ content.widgets.project_region.body.value }}
        {% endfor %}```
This will show the value's.

So now I made a select with the input but I really don't know how to filter this. With hubdb I would use a parameter query but how does this work with blog listings?

Option 2: Is it possible to create a hubdb row when a blog in this blog listing is created? this will give me alot of more options but here I dont even know where to start and if this is possible.
I'm running into this issue also
<@U7SL518D6> <@UP4QRQFFU> any ideas? (sorry for the tag, just seems like thishas been a potential issue for a while)

It could be that our validation is looking for the default module. Any reason why y’all need to use the cloned module vs. the default? The reason we enforce the default is that the Quoting app needs to rely on the module in order to render certain data. Plus, if we iterate on the feature, we can make changes to the default module without needing to ask you to copy our changes.
nothing resolved here, we are using the select type provisionally

Hello - I don't understand what my devs team is asking me for. They sent me this documentation for a form. Where can I find this information please? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication#:~:text=As%20this%20API%20is%20authenticated%2C>
Wasn’t there an option or a tool to load sample data in HubSpot? I can not remember the name, but did read it recently. Anyone a hint for me?
Looks like a different issue from what we experienced. Hope you'll find a solution, I'd love to help, but clueless...
